result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Vinton Figi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substance allowed.  Prescription medication to be taken as prescribed by medical provider.

Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 
2 days credit if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander Vinton Figi

defendant.name: Figi, Alexander Vinton
defendant.address: 520 W Elm St, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

DA Hatch: guilty to charge: 3 years probation- 90 days jail stayed, court costs ($518), AODA F/T, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. Atty Perrin and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Atty Perrin: agreement to charge without repeater. DA Hatch agrees. Court: repeater enhancer will be removed. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights . Defendant pleas guilty to charge w/o repeater enhancer. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty of charge w/o repeater enhancer. DA Hatch and Atty Perrin address sentencing. Court orders S/W 3 years probation; 90 days jail, stayed to be used at the agents discretion, court costs ($518), Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service. No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substance. Prescription medication to be taken as prescribed by medical provider.  Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoked. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:20

10:04 AM Defendant Alexander Vinton Figi in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Alexander Vinton Figi.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over Defendant's right to have a preliminary hearing. Defendant understands his rights and waives his right to preliminary hearing. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Judge Rohl to Atty Perrin's letter " Approve for rescheduling"
from Atty Perrin asking to set another date and to set a status to attempt to work out an agreement. She will be traveling and Defendant is awaiting surgery and in significant pain.

4:18 PM Defendant Alexander Vinton Figi does not appear in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DE was planning on retaining Atty Shirlene Perrin. DA Hatch is asking to reset this to trail 21CF16. Court will reset. Court adjourned at 4:20 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO ENTRY INTO BARS, TAVERNS AND LIQUOR STORES

3:53 PM ADA Kaley Walker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kaitlyn Dippolito appears in custody  via Zoom videoconferencing with the supervision of Atty. Travis Satorius.  Defendant Alexander Vinton Figi appeared via Zoom videoconferencing from PCJ.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court advises Defendant of constitutional rights.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of absolute sobriety and no entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard conditions.  Court questions Defendant's address, phone, dob.  Non-military.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearin.  Defendant does not qualify for PD.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
